kan
man
ikke
andet
end
indromme
at
resultatet
af
denne
oversigt
af
statens
indtægter
og
udgifter
for
det
ncevnte
aar
er
et

gladeligt
og
tilfredsstil

concerter

de
senere

er

i
hoi

for

isar
ved

bunn
the

en

thus

ofknives

10

mrdauuc
bust
of
tiic
rev
dr
bunting
—
a
beautiful
work
of
art
the
production
of
mr
sliakspeare
wood
sou
of
hamilton
wood
esq
of
leith
has
been
shewn
to
us
this
week
it
is
a
cast
forming
a
mailable
bust
of
dr
bunting
the
distinguished
preacher
in
the
vvesley
an
methodist
denomination
and
is
perhaps
the
most
faithful
likeness
that
was
ever
taken
of
that
eminent
man
the
bust
is
of
the
kit
cat
size
and
the
composition
from
which
it
is
prepared
is
eua
mellod
so
as
to
give
the
appearance
of
marble
several
of
dr
bunting
s
private

the
tree
is

large
and
the
gutta
pereha
which
is

in
the
sap
exudes
from
the

surfaces
in

form
of

air
the
juice
quickly

the
material
is
purified
by

it
in

water
or

it
in
water
and
then
it
becomes
a
ductile
soft
and
plastic
mass
from
the
docile
nature
of
the
material
neither
of
these

is
attended
with
the
difficulties
attached
to
the
manipulation
requisite
for
caoutchouc
gutta
percha
thus
prepared
for
use
possesses
very
curious
properties
below
the
temperature
of
fifty
degrees
it
is
as
bard
as
wood
but
in
will
receive
an
indentation
from
finger
nails
it
is
ex
cessi
ely
tough
and
only
flexible
in
the
condition
of
thin
slips
in
the
mass
it
has
a
good
deul
the
appearance
and
something
of
the
feel
of
horn
its
texture
is
somewhat
fibrous
and
from
tho
resistance
it
offers
to
any
thing
rubbed
across
it
it
appears
that
it
was
first
used
as
a
substitute
for
horn
for
the
handles
ofknives
and
choppers
by
an

of
heat
it
becomes

flexible
until
at
a
temperature

below
the
boiling
point
of
water
the
once
rigid
tough
and
obdurate
mass
becomes
like
so
much
softened
bees
wax
it
is
now
easily
cut
and
divided
in
any
manner
by
a
knife
and
may
be
moulded
into
all
varieties
of
form
with
the
greatest
ease
or
may
be
cut
and
united
again
so
perfectly
as
scarcely
to
exhibit
even
the
appearance
of
a
join
and
possessing
all
the
strength
of
an
undivided
mass
for
a
number
of
very
small
fragments
it
is
quite
easy
to
form
a
coherent
mass
as
firm
as
if
no
division
had
taken
place
whatever
be
the
shape
into
which
the
gutta
percha
is
now
formed
it
will
retain
precisely
the
same
form
as
it
cools
hardening
again
to
its
previous
state
of
rigidity
a
ball
an
inch
in
diameter
was
completely
softened
by
boiling
for
ten
minutes
and
regained
its
hardness
entirely
in
half
an
hour
it
is
an
important
fact
that
these
processes
may
be
alternated
any
number
of
times
without
injury
to
the
material
it
is
in
a
great
measure
devoid
of
elasticity
offering
a
striking
contrast
to
caoutchouc
but
its
tpnacity
is
little
less
than
wonderful
a
thin
slip
an
eighth
of
an
inch
substance
sustained
a
weight
of
forty
two
pounds
and
only
broke
with
the
pressure
of
fifty
two
pounds
it
offers
great
resistance
to
an
extending
power
but
when
drawn
out
it
remains
without
contracting
in
the
same
position
when
in
its
hard
state
it
is
cut
with
incredible
difficulty
by
the
knife
or
saw
like
caoutchouc
it
burns
brightly
when
lighted
disengaging
the
peuliar
odour
accompanying
the
combustion
of
that
substance
like
it
also
it
is
soluble
with
difficulty
in
ether
and
other
caoutchouc
solvents
but
very
readily
in
oil
of
turpentine
we
understand
the
quantity
imported
into
this
country
is
as
yet
hardly
sufficient
to
meet
the
demand
for
its
manufacture
but
as
the
source
is
exhaustless
there
is
no
fear
of
increasing
expensive
ness
already
the
public
are
becoming
familiar
with
it
—
nt
least
in
london
—
as
forming
the
additional
sole
for
shoes
that
are
partly
in
wear
but
besides
this
immense

of

now

of

sole
is

and

of

and

os
overdragne
vigtige
hværv
til
den
ende
andrage
vi
bl
a
i
sin

det
kgl
general

og
com

om

at

de
nævnte
aaer
nivellere
for
at

seildyb

kunde
grundforbe

og

en

hin

for

endelig
at

en

til

at

tarv
for

ifjor
og

og
har
under

oetbr
d
a

kgl

„kongen
op

og

—

hr

—

bunn
the
poet
who
has
long
sworn
like
ancient
pistol
to
horribly
revenge
the
wrongs
he
has
endured
1mm
punch
lias
at
length
put
his
design
into
execution
in
lire
shape
ot
a
brochure
ol
n
form
outwardly
resembling
the
publication
of
adversary
he
professes
to
indite
a
letter
entitled
a
word
with
punch
and
its
pith
and
purpose
are
to
depreciate
in
a
mingled
strain
of
banter
and
bitterness
the
merits
of
messrs
jerrold
a
beckett
and
mark
lemon
these
gentlemen
are
complime

with
the
natiiesof
wrong
hcad

and
tuickliead
and

their
past
scribbling
in
biiei
the

desirous
of

rack

which
for
the
amusement
of
tin
public
he
has

lie

thai
otiarp

in

to
mr
u
bccket

arc
such

would
ho

foibles
and
slant

have
ever

pntcuiale

but

ot

are

arc

—

meddeelt

det
nordifle
hvilket
giver

tonevarker

saa

material

in

and

for
caoutchouc
gutta
percha
thus
prepared
for
use
possesses

below
the

it
is
as
bard
as

but

deul

from
tho

to
any

it

was
first

for
horn
for
the
handles
ofknives
and

the

is

bet
»i
bergfte
